translation.en: [Maria] Single, stylish, now.
A lady's got to be ready for when it happens.
translation.ko: 여자가 준비해야 하는 그때 바로 지금 같은 순간

translation.en: It's my life.
And I'll do whatever it takes to get that sassafras feeling.
translation.ko: 이 나른한 즐거움을 위해 뭐든 할 거예요

translation.en: Sassafras.
Because when you feel this good...
Ain't no man gonna tell me I ain't a woman.
translation.ko: 어떤 남자가 나더러 여자가 아니라고 하겠어요?

translation.en: [woman] Uh, Maria. Maria.
Hey, Maria, what are you... what are you doing?
Uh, hair commercial?
It's the show. It's your show.
-Let's get you to the van, okay? -My show?
I have a show?
I'm a 45-year-old woman, who's clearly sun-damaged.
My skin is getting softer, yet my bones are jutting out,
so I'm half soft... half sharp.
And I have a show!
What a great late-in-life opportunity. [chuckling]
translation.ko: 오래 살다 보니 이런 날이 다 오네!

translation.en: [woman] Maria!
Wrong van.
I'm so excited to have my own sho--
[Maria] Hey, it's Maria Bamford.
translation.ko: “브루스 벤-배커랙” 마리아 뱀포드예요 내 매니저를 만나러 왔어요

translation.en: I'm here to see Bruce Ben-Bacharach. He's my manager.
translation.ko: 마리아 뱀포드예요 내 매니저를 만나러 왔어요

translation.en: Bruce.
-[Bruce] Ah! How are you? -Hi!
I'm thrilled to see you. You're looking lovely. Well, please come on in to my office.
-Hey! [chuckles] -The prodigal son returns.
I can't believe you've been away for six whole months.
So, tell me how do you feel? Are you refreshed? Revitalized? Renewed?
Yes, I do... I feel, uh...
I feel very good, a little tired, uh, because of the heavy meds.
translation.ko: 기분은 아주 좋아요 약 때문에 좀 피곤하지만

translation.en: But, uh, I'm also back on carbs.
I'm eating pancakes, uh, almost all day.
Well, the entire entertainment industry has been eagerly awaiting
-your glorious return. -Well...
Now that you're back,
-you tell me exactly what you wanna do. -Right.
Uh, TV show, movie, world comedy tour... and I'm gonna take a shot at getting it.
translation.ko: TV, 영화, 코미디 투어 말만 해, 꽂아줄게

translation.en: -[stammering] Yeah. -Uh, Chantrelle!
Get me the, uh, hidden big opportunities list, would you?
Okay, I would like to do less, not more.
translation.ko: 너무 많은 걸 하고 싶진 않아요

translation.en: That's the thing. Could it be less ambitious?
Or maybe not ambitious, anymore.
Less ambitious.
No work for Maria.
So that makes my job easier.
Tad less income, perhaps.
I mean, I wanna work a little, but, uh, just smaller things.
translation.ko: 일은 할 건데 부담 없는 거로요

translation.en: Less pressure. Maybe... stand-up at a book store, or...
alone in my living room or in a vintage eyeglass shop.
translation.ko: 집에 혼자 있는 것도 좋고 골동품 안경점이나...

translation.en: I'm just trying to get some balance in my life.
I've done some things I regret
translation.ko: 실수도 많이 했고 사람들한테 미움도 샀고...

translation.en: -and I made some enemies, I'm sure... -[Chantrelle] Mark "Sugar Ray" McGrath.
translation.ko: 실수도 많이 했고 사람들한테 미움도 샀고... 마크 맥그래스?

translation.en: Okay.
The... What?
The singer?
Uh, you were a bit careless, but we... We can, uh...
[chuckles nervously] We can laugh about that now.
translation.ko: 이젠 다 웃고 넘길 수 있어

translation.en: -I bet they can buff that out. -I'm sure they can.
translation.ko: - AS 보내면 될 거야 - 그럴 거예요

translation.en: You know what it is?
I just really wanna reconnect with my community. You know, it's like, I don't even know who my neighbors are.
Forgive my distraction. This is a $37,000 handblown Murano glass desk...
-Oh, my God. -so I'm somewhat irked with myself.
Yes, neighbors. A serendipitous meeting on a park bench.
"How do you do, sir?"
"I'm fine, thank you." "Is that your dog, sir?"
That's it.
Human interaction. Yes, indeed. I'm gonna make some calls.
translation.ko: 사람들과의 상호작용 - 내가 제안해볼게 - 완전 좋아요

translation.en: I love it. I love it.
A neighborhood park bench. That's exactly what was on my vision board.
translation.ko: '동네 공원의 벤치' 내 비전 보드에도 있었어요

translation.en: In the psych ward, I kept cutting out pictures of benches for my vision board.
translation.ko: 정신병원에서 비전 보드에 벤치 사진을 붙였었죠

translation.en: -But I didn't know why. And now I know. -[mouths] Bench.
translation.ko: 난 공동체의 화합을 이룰 인물이었나 봐요

translation.en: It was to manifest community.
Bruce, you did it! I confess I'm not exactly sure what you're talking about,
translation.ko: - 브루스가 해냈어요 - 이해는 잘 안 되지만

translation.en: but it seems you're happy with me, and that's what matters.
-Yes. -Solutions everywhere.
And by the way, I'm gonna call these people, I'm gonna say they delivered the desk that way...
translation.ko: 책상 판매처에 전화해서 이 상태로 왔다고 해야겠어

translation.en: and how dare you, sir.
Really... I mean, why should I pay for the buffing? [chuckling]
Well, uh... that's it.
I just put my foot through my nest egg.
[Maria] The bench had arrived,
so I invited over my two best friends to start spreading the joy.
translation.ko: 내 절친 둘을 불러 기쁨을 전파하기로 했죠

translation.en: -Hey, dipshit. -Hey!
-What's with the bench? -Hey. Well, it is, uh, to connect
and create community.
How fun.
Isn't this great? It's all coming together.
translation.ko: 이웃들끼리 친하게 지낼 수 있을 거야

translation.en: Why? 'Cause you have a bench now?
It's not just my bench, it's your bench, Dagmar.
It's your bench, Larissa.
-Thank you. -[stuttering] It's your bench,
Highland Park lovers!
Come have a seat!
Oh, I get it. This bench is a way for you to access romance.
translation.ko: 알겠다, 이 벤치로 남자를 낚으려는 거구나?

translation.en: -No. No. -[Larissa] Yes.
-It's like a fuck bench? I love that. -No, no, no!
translation.ko: - 섹스 벤치야? 좋은데? - 그런 거 아냐

translation.en: That's the way to build a community. Just sit here all night, just sucking Ds,
translation.ko: 이웃끼리 아주 친해지겠네 여기 앉아서 빨아주는 거지 입안이 다 헐도록

translation.en: knocking out your teeth, having a good time.
translation.ko: 여기 앉아서 빨아주는 거지 입안이 다 헐도록

translation.en: [Larissa] Not what I would tell a good friend in need.
You wanna know why? 'Cause you're a bad friend.
I am a wonderful friend.
-Oh, really? -Mmm-hmm. You didn't even visit Maria in her time of need.
Okay, no. We've already talked about this. I didn't need to be visited and besides,
translation.ko: 이 얘긴 이미 끝났잖아 찾아올 필요도 없었어

translation.en: -I'm sure you were very busy, Larissa. -I wasn't.
-Okay. -I wasn't busy... busy at all.
No, I didn't come because I'm an empath
and when people are experiencing negative emotion,
-it sticks to me... hardcore. -[Maria] Hmm.
-Yeah. -So, I guess it's like,
I cared too much to show up.
You're a bad friend. A very bad friend.
Look at this! The bench has got us communicating as a group.
translation.ko: 봐! 벤치에 앉으니까 저절로 대화하게 되잖아?

translation.en: -Let's go meet the neighbors! -Okay.
Oh, God, I'm terrified.
Hi.
Uh, I'm Maria... and your name is, please, sir?
-Oscar. -Hi, Oscar, um...
I am your neighbor and these are my friends, uh...
translation.ko: 전 이 동네 주민이고 쟤들은 제 친구예요

translation.en: Just wanted to let you know I put in a park bench that I wanted to invite you to come over and enjoy.
translation.ko: 제가 벤치를 하나 놨는데 같이 앉아서 얘기할까요?

translation.en: -Great-- -Go fuck yourself.
Okay...
Hi! I'm Maria. I'm from...
I live across the street and, um...
I think it's helpful for the community--
Okay, okay.
[Maria] It's okay. They'll change their minds
once they see that my bench is now covered in garbage.
-Okay. Oh, and pigeons. -Oh, no.
[Larissa] Did you see all these condoms over here?
-[siren wails] -Evening, ladies.
-Hi, Officer. -You know, you can't just...
dump your furniture and garbage out here. Oh, no, it's not garbage.
It's a neighborhood bench. It's... it's for the community.
Do you have a permit for the community bench?
translation.ko: 공공 벤치 설치에 대한 허가는 받으셨나요?

translation.en: -Oh, no. Is that required? -It is.
And, uh, if you don't have one, you're gonna have to go down to...
City Hall and get one.
-Or I can write you a 4950. -[Maria groans] I don't wanna write you a 4950.
translation.ko: 안 그러면 딱지를 끊을 수밖에 없어요

translation.en: Okay, I... I can't do it right now.
translation.ko: 지금은 안 돼요 스탠드업 준비해야 해서요

translation.en: -I've gotta get ready for a stand-up gig. -Oh, invite him.
translation.ko: 지금은 안 돼요 스탠드업 준비해야 해서요 - 오라고 해 - 그럼...

translation.en: [Maria] Maybe...
Look at that helmet. That's a good shaped head, if you know what I mean.
Would you wanna come to a comedy show?
They're so wonderful.
[stammering] Oh, God.
Maria, I'm sorry. Come here.
You're gonna put stand-up in your show?
-[man] Cut! -Yeah. I mean, is that bad?
It's... Yeah, it's bad.
It is bad. It's been done so many times before.
You know, you got Louie, Seinfeld, Chappelle, Amy Schumer, my two pilots...
-No, they didn't go. -I'm so sorry.
We haven't officially met. Uh, are you the comedy police?
I'm a friend giving friendly advice.
Well, you're also an actor, so just say your lines, monkey.
Give your audience some credit.
They can deal with form-busting narrative innovations.
translation.ko: 아주 파격적인 걸 해도 다들 이해해요

translation.en: -Okay. -We've all seen Breaking Bad. All right, well, I haven't.
Okay, you gotta see it. Anna Gunn is amazing in it.
But look, people can deal with the... with the time jump.
translation.ko: 시청자들은 시간 여행도 소화할 수 있어요

translation.en: All right? Just... [stuttering] just don't make it jarring.
Well, if we do, we definitely wouldn't do it in a way that was... was jarring.
Here you go.
And don't thank me. I'm a stranger.
-[Maria] Hi. Hi. -Karen Grisham.
-Come here, I'm a hugger. I'm a hugger. -Oh, thank you. Oh.
Congrats, Maria. -You made the Grish-list. -Oh.
translation.ko: 축하해요, 마리아 내 눈에 딱 띄었잖아

translation.en: Maria, I am the most powerful talent agent in this city or galaxy.
And you know why? Every time I walk into a room
translation.ko: 난 누구든 보는 순간 그 사람을 어떻게

translation.en: I know exactly how I would kill each person I see. [waiter] Arnold Palmer?
Elbow to the forehead, golf pencil through the heart.
translation.ko: 팔꿈치로 이마를 찍고 연필로 심장을 찌른다

translation.en: -I think he meant the drink. -Oh.
A fuckin' beverage. Fuck off, I'm in a meeting.
Look, open-kimono time. I asked you to lunch 'cause I'm a fan.
-This is a fan lunch, okay? -Wow.
The world loves you. I love you.
You are a hilarious...
-Comedian. -[both laughing]
So, you wanna represent me or...
Are you kidding me? I would murder that waiter
translation.ko: 그럴 수 있다면 저 웨이터라도 죽일 거야

translation.en: by snapping his gay neck and jamming that oyster fork in both eyes to represent you.
translation.ko: 그 게이 목을 꺾고 포크로 양쪽 눈을 찔러서라도

translation.en: But Karen Grisham is booked. I'm sorry, she got a full boat.
-Ah. -I got so many goddamn clients.
-Yeah. -And honestly,
I just wanna be your friend, okay?
translation.ko: - 그래요 - 그냥 친구 어떨까? 트레비 분수에서 파파라치가 쫓아와서

translation.en: When paparazzi chase you around the Trevi Fountain
trying to get a shot of your rancid snapper, I got your back.
-Aw, that's so nice. -Okay? I swear to God,
I will airlift in one of those Italian fucking scooter things.
What are they fucking called? Ves... Ves... Uh...
-Ves... uh... -Vespa.
Oh, that's good. That's good.
-[laughing] -Oh, come on. Come on.
You on a Vespa?
Okay, that is my new favorite image of all time. I swear to God, that is so good.
translation.ko: 상상만 해도 너무 좋다 아주 마음에 들어

translation.en: -See? We're friends, right? -Yeah, I know, yeah.
You're riding tall on the Vespa and I'm in your, uh... What the fuck's cunt is that called?
translation.ko: 자긴 베스파를 타고 나는... 젠장! 뭐더라?

translation.en: That thing, the side thing, um... When it's attached to the motorcycle.
translation.ko: 오토바이 옆에 붙어 가는 거 뭐지?

translation.en: It's part of the... What the fuck! Oh, God. -Sidecar. -[screaming and laughing]
-Sidecar. You are a riot. -Yeah.
Okay, that is our inside joke. That is ours. -That is ours. Okay? -Okay.
-Vespa sidecar is you and me. -[laughing] Okay, okay.
I adore you.
God, I wish I could rep you.
translation.ko: 내가 자기를 맡으면 정말 좋을 텐데

translation.en: I... [laughing] Okay, wait. -No, stop, stop. -[bleating]
Honestly, I just wanna be your best friend. I do.
translation.ko: 본론으로 돌아와서 난 그냥 절친이면 만족해

translation.en: Because you have a manager and I would never wanna poach you from...
Who's that guy that you're with? -Bruce Ben-Bacharach. He's my manager. -Oh.
Look, do me a favor. Don't tell Bruce about this meeting.
translation.ko: - 나 만났단 말 하지 마 - 당연하죠

translation.en: -Oh, my gosh. -He'll get threatened.
translation.ko: - 나 만났단 말 하지 마 - 당연하죠 위기감 느껴서 자살할지도 몰라

translation.en: And I don't have the time to walk him off the ledge.
I adore you. This has been a joy.
-[laughing] -This is unbelievable. I swear to God...
translation.ko: 나랑 정말 잘 맞아 아직 커피도 안 마셨네

translation.en: -I haven't even had coffee. -Did you want anything to order?
translation.ko: 나랑 정말 잘 맞아 아직 커피도 안 마셨네 - 주문했어요? - 아니, 약속이 또 있어

translation.en: -Oh, no, I have another lunch. -Okay.
-[woman] Right this way, Mr. Cryer. -[snaps fingers] Jon Cryer.
-Karen Grisham. -Hi. You're... Okay.
-Oh, my... Come here. -[Maria] So great.
-Come over here. Give me some sugar. -Okay. Oh. Oh, sorry.
-Okay. -[Jon] Thank you.
Sweetheart, this is gonna be a private lunch.
-Okay, okay, sorry. -You wanna take the chair?
translation.ko: - 우리 둘이 얘기할 거야 - 미안해요 의자 필요해? 가서 오붓하게 시간 보내

translation.en: It'll be private. No one else will barge in on us.
translation.ko: 의자 필요해? 가서 오붓하게 시간 보내

translation.en: -Okay, okay. -All right, you be well.
She's a comedian. She's funny... I think. I've never seen her work.
translation.ko: 재능 있는 코미디언이에요 작품은 본 적 없지만

translation.en: -Congrats. You made the Grish-list. -Oh.
translation.ko: 재능 있는 코미디언이에요 작품은 본 적 없지만 축하해요 내 눈에 딱 들었어

translation.en: Actually, I'm... I'm happy with my representation. I'm sorry.
Read the note!
Right.
"Vespa, hah! Best friend sidecar! Hah, hah, hah!"
-Wha... -It's our joke!
It's our private joke.
-It's a Vespa. -Right.
-It's for you. -[both laughing]
-Okay, bye. -Get on the fucking bike!
-You're gonna ride it! -[Maria] Oh, okay.
I have a car! I guess I'll just leave it here.
translation.ko: 차 가지고 왔는데 여기 두고 가야겠네요

translation.en: Bruce. Hi. Karen Grisham told me that she had lunch with you
and you guys are friends and have an inside joke. I was wondering if we could have a discussion about that?
translation.ko: 둘만의 농담도 했다던데 나랑 얘기 좀 할까?

translation.en: Yeah. Of course, of course.
So, what else did she say? And don't leave out a single thing, okay?
translation.ko: 그 여자가 뭐래? 하나도 빼놓지 말고 말해줘

translation.en: Well, uh, she says we're BFFs.
My God, that means she wants to represent you.
Oh, no, she doesn't.
She was very clear on that. She just wants to be best friends.
translation.ko: 딱 선을 긋던데요 그냥 절친만 되는 거라고

translation.en: And that sounds pretty good to me,
translation.ko: 괜찮은 제안 같아요 내 매니저는 브루스잖아요

translation.en: -You're my manager, that's all I need. -Are you crazy?
translation.ko: 괜찮은 제안 같아요 내 매니저는 브루스잖아요 농담해? 캐런을 붙잡아야 돈을 벌 수 있어

translation.en: Karen Grisham is our only chance of making some real money.
translation.ko: 농담해? 캐런을 붙잡아야 돈을 벌 수 있어

translation.en: You're a 36-year-old sun-damaged actress with eight cartoons on your résumé.
translation.ko: 자긴 36살에 피부도 후져 경력은 만화 8편이 전부야

translation.en: -[whispering] Oh, that's a good point. -Karen Grisham is a shark.
Let me be the chum to drive her to a frenzy of interest.
translation.ko: 내가 고깃덩이 역할을 해서 상어를 유인할게

translation.en: Bruce, doesn't chum get devoured?
[chuckling] Not smart chum.
Speaking of which, come this way.
I had a little bit of a self-touching problem as a kid,
translation.ko: 어릴 때, 내가 거시기에서 하도 손을 안 떼니까

translation.en: so my father insisted that I have a lot of hobbies
translation.ko: 어릴 때, 내가 거시기에서 하도 손을 안 떼니까 아버지가 손을 쓰는 취미를 갖게 만드셨지

translation.en: where I work with my hands.
translation.ko: 아버지가 손을 쓰는 취미를 갖게 만드셨지

translation.en: -Ta-da! -Oh, Bruce, what did you do?
I chummed it up! So, what do you think?
[stammers] I was gonna return it. Now it's all messed up.
You've got solder all over it.
That's not solder actually, those are little bits of flesh from my hand.
translation.ko: 땜질 자국이 아니라 손에서 떨어진 살점이야

translation.en: -[sighing] -This can work.
You know, this is harmony.
Karen sits here, that's great. That's Karen.
Maximum respect.
I am over here, at the end.
Like Pluto, the most important planet.
Because it contains from the perimeter.
I don't... I don't think that's how Karen saw it.
Why don't we motor on over there right now and we can show her for herself?
She can see. Go ahead.
Take the seat of command.
-[Maria groaning] -Go on.
-[man] Hey! -Hi!
Gotta admit it, Bruce, you got me kind of excited to join Karen's flock.
translation.ko: 캐런과 한 팀이 되면 정말 좋을 것 같긴 해요

translation.en: You and me, both.
Make a hard left before Beverly Hills Whale Oil! -[thud] -[screeching]
-Are you okay? Okay. -Great!
-[Maria] That's a great deal on whale oil! -[Bruce screaming]
translation.ko: 기름 가격 괜찮네요! “베벌리 힐스 고래 기름 첫 거래시 1통 공짜”

translation.en: [Maria] That wasn't even the worst thing I'd done to Bruce.
translation.ko: 내가 브루스에게 한 최악의 진상짓은 더 있어요

translation.en: But now I was back and healthy,
I was determined to make things right with all the people I'd hurt.
translation.ko: 이젠 건강을 되찾았으니 상처 준 사람들과 화해를 해야죠

translation.en: Mark, you old such and such.
[Mark over phone] Suck my dick, Bruce.
[Maria] Even the ones I don't remember hurting.
You know, Mark, for a man who is widely known as Sugar Ray, you are somewhat under-endowed in sweetness.
translation.ko: 명색이 슈가 레이인데 말투는 달콤하지가 않군요

translation.en: Uh, nevertheless, I have here with me, the one and only, Maria Bamford.
translation.ko: 우리 스타 마리아 뱀포드도 같이 있어요

translation.en: Hey, Mark.
-Oh, God. -Great news, Mark.
Maria has agreed to perform a stand-up benefit for your Open Arms charity.
-Really? -Yes, yes, super really!
I... I didn't even know you had a charity,
translation.ko: 마크가 자선 행사를 한다는 거 몰랐는데

translation.en: -but Bruce told me about it. -Oh, big fan.
Yeah, so Open Arms. Wow! I... I'm all about that.
Openness and engagement and... and sometimes partying.
And I thought we could combine your charity
translation.ko: 행사를 하는 김에 블록 파티도 열어서

translation.en: with a block party to unveil my new bench.
Yes, two pelicans with one Miata!
That sounds good. A block party could be very cool.
Indeed! And by the way, Mark...
♪ I'm so glad you answered the phone ♪
You're paying for that usage.
[Maria] Larissa, I have a really important assistant job for you.
translation.ko: “마리아의 집” 라리사, 정말 중요한 부탁이 있어

translation.en: Could you make copies of this for the block party?
And make sure that Mark McGrath's Open Arms charity logo is on it.
translation.ko: 마크의 오픈 암스 행사 로고도 꼭 박아줘

translation.en: I don't have a car, so maybe Dagmar can do it.
What?
Can you make copies of this Open Arms flyer for the block party?
translation.ko: 오픈 암스 블록 파티 전단지 복사하래

translation.en: -Open Arms? -Yeah, it's Mark's charity.
Do you even know what Open Arms is all about?
Uh, children and hugging, I hope.
No, no, no, no. Excuse me.
They're lobbying to change open carry laws,
so people can go into Starbucks with semi-automatic weapons, Maria.
-[Larissa gasps] -Oh, no.
-[Dagmar] Yes! -No. Oh.
Okay, I'm not carrying a gun for you, okay? That... that's where I draw the line.
translation.ko: 아무리 조수라도 너 때문에 총을 들고 다닐 순 없어

translation.en: Although, now that we're talking about Starbucks,
translation.ko: 근데 스타벅스 얘기하니까 톨 사이즈 프라페 당기네

translation.en: -I'd love a tall frappe. -Mark didn't say anything about guns.
translation.ko: 근데 스타벅스 얘기하니까 톨 사이즈 프라페 당기네 총 얘긴 없었는데

translation.en: Okay, maybe I can make this work.
This is a charitable event for people speaking their minds,
which I support, even if I hate what they're saying.
translation.ko: 내용이 맘에 안 들어도 대화한다는 건 좋은 거지

translation.en: -And being open is good, right? -[Larissa] Mmm.
translation.ko: 내용이 맘에 안 들어도 대화한다는 건 좋은 거지 - 마음을 여는 것도 좋고 - 그렇지

translation.en: Oh, God, yes!
Oh, your little bicycle buddy's back.
-[woman] She's still got the bench here. -Thank you, Regina.
Cop is there. Oh, jeez.
Larissa, some assistance, please! Larissa!
-So, how's the new job going? -It's terrible.
Okay.
-Good evening. -Hello, Officer.
Okay, uh, if you don't have a permit for the bench...
translation.ko: 벤치 놓는 거 허가 안 받으면

translation.en: I'm gonna have to issue a bench warrant.
Are you kidding me? Maria...
you're gonna have a stage with a red brick wall behind...
[man] Cutting again.
This is what I was telling you. She's doing stand-up in the show.
Maria, you can't do stand-up. We're really bummed out about it.
translation.ko: 마리아, 스탠드업은 안 돼 - 다들 반대라고 - 경찰이에요?

translation.en: Are you a cop?
Yeah, he's supposed to be. Look at this. This is the costume he puts together.
translation.ko: 경찰로 출연하랬더니 복장 좀 봐요 2시간 전에 알려줬잖아요

translation.en: Give me a break. You gave me two hours' notice.
[stammers] And I auditioned to be the love interest.
I'm not gonna make out with anyone, am I?
translation.ko: 난 애정신에 오디션 본 건데 부비는 건 안 찍나 봐요?

translation.en: -Just don't do stand-up. -I hear what you're saying.
translation.ko: - 스탠드업은 하지 마요 - 무슨 말인지 알겠어요

translation.en: But this time I was gonna use stand-up to explain why I went back to Duluth.
translation.ko: 둘루스에 왜 갔었는지 설명하려 했단 말이에요

translation.en: We gotta show three different time periods in this show.
translation.ko: 방송을 세 가지 시기로 나눠서 해야겠어요

translation.en: And I don't wanna lose the audience. Well, make it look different, you know?
Use... use color as a time signifier. Mess with the saturation.
-[buzzer buzzing] -Okay. Oh, uh, and, uh, get... get a permit for that bench.
translation.ko: 참, 그리고... 벤치 허가 꼭 받아요

translation.en: -Yes. -Is any of this usable?
Too gray.
Ew, too yellow.
[gasping] More blue?
[stammers] Less blue. Split the difference.
That's perfect. That's it. -[Janice] You want blue? Here's a blue. -Okay.
Let's hear it for Maria, who is lapping everyone
translation.ko: “둘루스” 4번째 비전 보드를 만든 마리아의 얘기를 들어보죠

translation.en: with her fourth vision board.
translation.ko: 4번째 비전 보드를 만든 마리아의 얘기를 들어보죠

translation.en: Although, she does have an advantage with her hypomania.
translation.ko: 이럴 땐 조증이 도움이 되기도 하네요

translation.en: Excuse me, Janice.
I brought in the People mag, Oscar issue, and someone cut out all the Oscars.
translation.ko: 누가 오스카 특집호에서 오스카를 다 잘라갔어요

translation.en: I have no Oscars for my vision board.
We should all not hog the Oscars, Dan.
Sorry my dreams are inconvenient for you, Donna!
translation.ko: 내 꿈 때문에 불편했다면 미안해요, 도나

translation.en: Hey, whoa, Dan, Donna, there's enough Oscars for everyone.
translation.ko: 댄, 도나, 오스카는 쉽게 가질 수 있어요

translation.en: Maria, there are not enough Oscars for everyone, as we tragically learn every year.
translation.ko: 쉽게 가질 수 없다는 걸 매년 확인하고 있잖아요

translation.en: [Dan] Donna used all the glitter.
-The dirty cunt. -[Donna gasps]
Hey, we're all here to get along.
translation.ko: 우린 서로 잘 지내려고 모인 거예요

translation.en: No, Maria, we are not.
We are all here to better ourselves,
and sometimes that means expressing your negative emotions.
translation.ko: 그러려면 부정적인 감정도 표현할 수 있어야 해요

translation.en: In... in a constructive way.
Is there anyone in group who just... who really, really chaps your crapper?
translation.ko: 이 중에서 정말 짜증 나는 그런 사람 없어요?

translation.en: -Anything. -No! Everyone here is super nice.
Well, that's something that we need to work on.
Because Donna is a straight-up "B."
And Dan makes me wanna take every pill in my desk drawer!
translation.ko: 댄을 감당하려면 남아나는 약이 없을 거야!

translation.en: Do you see how easy that was to say?
[man over radio] Duluth. The shining jewel of the Gopher State.
The second largest city on Lake Superior shores.
Home of the longest freshwater sandbar in the world.
But you can't get a drink here, it's made of sand. Duluth.
translation.ko: 음료는 마실 수 없어요 모래가 씹히거든요

translation.en: Oh! How was your day, sweetie?
I don't wanna go back.
They're angry and they... they want me to get angry. And...
translation.ko: 다들 화를 내고 나한테도 화내라고 하고

translation.en: I'm not... [slurping]
I'm not angry.
How does that make you feel?
Fine.
Give it time. You'll get angry.
translation.ko: 더 있어 봐 화가 날 거야

translation.en: Well, I gotta go see a man about a burrito.
translation.ko: 난 부리토 때문에 누굴 좀 만나야겠다

translation.en: Joel, you cannot go out now. Maria just got home.
translation.ko: 조엘, 나중에 가 마리아가 방금 왔잖아

translation.en: I thought we weren't gonna treat her differently just 'cause her frontal lobe went on the fritz.
translation.ko: 쟤 머리가 돌았다고 특별 대우 않기로 했잖아

translation.en: -[door closes] -[woman] Special delivery!
[chuckling] One USDA Choice pug.
You're welcome, Maria, for taking such good care of him
while you were in the loony bin.
-[dog whimpering] -What's that, Bert?
Oh, you wanna stay with Mama Susan?
Oh, that's not very nice, Bert.
[laughs] She's not a mental veg on rye.
Bert, I missed you so much.
-[Susan] Here you go. -[Maria panting]
-[chuckling] -Susan, you are so thoughtful.
I don't know what Maria did to get a friend like you.
-[chuckling] -[Susan] I'm used to picking up her slack.
translation.ko: 넌 마리아에겐 과분한 친구야 마리아 뒤치다꺼리는 제 전문이죠

translation.en: Ever since she tinkled on the seat in kindergarten. [laughs]
-Remember that, Maria? -Yes. -Remember? -Yes.
-[Susan] You remember? -[Maria] I do.
So, how was the lollipop factory, Ms. Sylvia Plath Jr.?
How was Janice today?
Is Janice still operating the group over there?
-Yeah. -Oh, she's a bit of a mess herself.
She caught her sister with her husband... in flagrante delicto.
translation.ko: 남편이 언니랑 있는 걸 현장에서 목격했거든

translation.en: They were having sex right smack dab in the middle of the living room
in front of the Shih Tzus. Or were they Havanese?
Well, either way, they were innocents.
They didn't deserve that.
But I guess we all fall short of the glory of God.
translation.ko: 우린 하느님께 은혜를 받을 자격이 없어

translation.en: Great therapist, though.
Yeah, she's really funny.
[Susan] I just hope they can shrink Maria's brain.
translation.ko: 마리아의 뇌도 고칠 수 있으면 좋을 텐데

translation.en: Isn't that funny?
All the fame and fortune of Hollywood can't save you...
if your brain done broke!
And how does that make you feel?
Hungry.
I'll get dinner then.
This is called truth badminton.
Each player has to express a frustration whenever you hit the birdie.
translation.ko: 짜증 나는 일을 말하면서 치는 거죠

translation.en: All right, begin!
You're weak!
You have interesting bangs.
You're selfish!
You have wonderful teeth!
Say something angry!
That's a cute sweater!
No one likes you!
I do enjoy my time alone!
You don't belong anywhere!
At least my sister didn't give my ex-husband a blowjob
translation.ko: 난 전남편이랑 오럴 하는 그런 언니는 없어!

translation.en: in front of my two underage Maltese!
I'm so sorry. I'm so...
Oh, God.
They were Shih Tzus.
[Maria] I knew what it was like to be ostracized by my community.
translation.ko: “현재” 마을 사람들에게 외면받는 건 더는 싫었죠

translation.en: And I didn't want that.
translation.ko: 마을 사람들에게 외면받는 건 더는 싫었죠

translation.en: So I made it clear to Bruce
translation.ko: 그래서 브루스에게 블록 파티에서 코미디는 안 한다고 했어요

translation.en: that I would not do stand-up at the block party.
translation.ko: 블록 파티에서 코미디는 안 한다고 했어요

translation.en: Now, I'd like to introduce to you a friend of mine...
but instead, here's the comedy of Maria Bamford.
-[scattered applause] -Comedy?
I thought... You told him, right?
I... I'm not supposed to do comedy.
I did tell him.
Listen, he's a musician, they're all hopheads.
-Don't worry, I'll take care of it. -Okay, okay.
-Oh, God. -Thank you, everybody.
What, uh, Mark neglected to mention is that, uh,
the VIP wristbands are only good for one orange drink.
-Thank you. -[man] Orange drink sucks!
Oh, uh, yes, everybody, please enjoy the hilarious comedy
of the great Maria Bamford!
Okay, um... [chuckling nervously]
Thank you so much. Uh, let's not call it comedy,
let's call it neighbor talk.
Oh, Christ. You weren't kidding.
-She's gonna do stand-up on her show. -[Patton sighs]
[Patton] Look at that brick wall. Louis is gonna shit.
translation.ko: 저 벽돌벽 좀 봐요 루이스가 기절하겠네

translation.en: Welcome to our first annual neighborhood block party
translation.ko: 제1회 마을 블록 파티에 와주셔서 감사합니다

translation.en: and Open Arms, open carry, guns-for-everyone benefit.
translation.ko: 제1회 마을 블록 파티에 와주셔서 감사합니다 총기 소지 자유를 위한 오픈 암스 파티예요

translation.en: -[gunshot] -Oh, God! Okay.
translation.ko: 총기 소지 자유를 위한 오픈 암스 파티예요 깜짝이야

translation.en: I just meant maybe we could clap instead, just-- -[gunshot] -Oh, God! Okay.
translation.ko: 총 대신 박수를 치면... 그래요, 알았어요

translation.en: -[crowd cheering] -There's no need to-- -[gunshot] -[Maria] Oh!
But the point is, I am not doing comedy,
I am just trying to bring people together because you mean so much to me. You do.
And, uh, I really want so much to be a part of this community,
-I love... I love you. -[guns cocking]
Be funnier!
-You really should try to be funny. -[whispering] Okay, okay.
I... Okay. Uh...
-You guys thinking of shooting her? -It's come up.
translation.ko: - 쏠 생각 하고 있어요? - 그러고는 싶은데

translation.en: We're kicking it around.
A while back, I was making a vision board...
translation.ko: 마을을 위해 할 수 있는 일이 뭔지 생각해봤어요

translation.en: -[gunshot] -Uh, to manifest my need for community,
translation.ko: 마을을 위해 할 수 있는 일이 뭔지 생각해봤어요 벤치 사진을 오려서 비전 보드에 붙였죠

translation.en: and I cut out a picture of a park bench and I pasted that on there.
translation.ko: 벤치 사진을 오려서 비전 보드에 붙였죠

translation.en: Hey, fuck this fuck bench!
Oh, you're doing great! [laughing]
Okay, that's Oscar. [chuckling]
He's one of the wonderful, angry...
angry, wonderful people in our neighborhood.
translation.ko: 화를 잘 내는 아주 좋은 이웃인데요

translation.en: [whispering] What should I do? -Hands off the mic stand. -Okay.
[inhaling sharply] Ladies and gentlemen, Patton Oswalt! He can do comedy!
-[cheering] -He can do comedy!
-[crowd whooping] -Because it's not his... -show! -[Mark] Thanks a lot.
-Hey, guys. [laughs] -[gunshot]
Wow, I know a lot of you guys are pissed off.
I've been pissed off all day, you know.
And here's... You know, the thing about being pissed off is if you're really pissed off,
translation.ko: 그런데 그거 아세요? 그렇게 열 받다가

translation.en: the joke's probably on you.
Oh, honey, wake up, wake up.
[sighs] Your purple van is almost here.
No, they're not coming.
They're never coming again.
Not after badminton.
[Patton] It doesn't matter if you piss people off, what matters is the people who show up after you piss them off.
translation.ko: 나한테 화가 났더라도 다시 날 만나주는 사람

translation.en: -[gasps] -Those are the people to hang on to.
They're here.
I need my backpack!
[Patton] Real friends are always there for you. And you're always there for them.
translation.ko: 진짜 친구들은 언제나 서로의 곁을 지켜요

translation.en: With the exception of my friend Maria,
who I don't know how much longer I'm gonna be there for.
translation.ko: 물론 마리아는 예외죠 내가 언제까지 곁에 있어 줄 수 있을지 모르겠어요

translation.en: Guys, look, you can't...
[chuckles] So, it looks like love isn't gonna find me anytime soon.
translation.ko: 사랑을 찾으려면 시간이 걸릴 것 같아요

translation.en: Or friendship and community.
But you know what? I'm on a journey.
And my show seems like it's really finding its own voice.
translation.ko: 이 프로그램도 확실한 목소리를 내고 있고요

translation.en: Hey, apropos of nothin',
uh, do you guys love or hate the term "gun nuts"?
-[bullet ricocheting] -Okay.
It's Patton's voice. But he is very good.
...express how you feel, whether it's good or bad.
And do not let people force you to do what you don't wanna do!
translation.ko: 어떤 일도 남들의 강요로 하지는 말라는 거죠

translation.en: [woman] Like this bench!
Yes, there you go! Thank you! Don't get pissed off at each other.
Get pissed off at that bench.
-[all cheering] -[woman] That's right!
[man] Let's take down this wooden abortion! -Yeah! -Come on!
My bench is bringing everyone together!
Vision board!
Boom! Manifested.
[choir singing] ♪ I don't know what I'm doing ♪
[Maria] Yeah!
♪ More than half of the time ♪
[laughing] Good job.
[female announcer] Lady Dynamite was brought to you by...
[Maria] Single, stylish, now.
A lady's got to be ready for when it happens.
I'm a silly gooseneck.
And right now...
...it's happening.
I feel French.
[laughs] Oh, flowers for me? No, thanks.
Sometimes you just have to take a ride when life wants you to.
translation.ko: 때로는 삶에 몸을 맡기고 달려야 해요

translation.en: -Bye. -[bicycle bell ringing]
Who knows what romance it will bring.
It's not what's in your head, it's what's on it.
translation.ko: 머리는 안에 든 것보다 껍데기가 중요해요

translation.en: Hair that's so shiny and full...
Can you blame them for looking?
No time to pay. [giggling]
I love being a woman.
Can a man do this?
First lady on the moon.
All thanks to Latrisse DuVois Hair Care Products...
by Gary.
I just had my tubes tied.
At my age, it's not safe to have children.
translation.ko: 내 나이에 애를 갖는 건 위험하니까요

translation.en: -[tires squealing] -Get out of the way, you gypsies!
